intro: Nyctocalos, commonly known as the night-flowering moonflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night and close by morning. The flowers emit a strong, sweet fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Nyctocalos species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. These plants are typically shrubs or trees with smooth, often hairy stems and alternate leaves.
